memberdef.argsstring: (const Graph< T > &graph, const T &startAirport, const T &endAirport)
memberdef.name: findShortestPath

briefdescription.para: Find the shortest paths from a start airport to an end airport in a graph.

detaileddescription.para: This function uses Dijkstra's algorithm to find the shortest paths from a start airport to an end airport in the given graph. It returns a vector of vectors, where each inner vector represents a distinct shortest path.

memberdef.argsstring: (const Graph< T > &graph, const unordered_map< T, int > &distance, const T &end, const T &current, vector< T > &currentPath, vector< vector< T > > &allPaths, size_t initialSize=2)
memberdef.name: backtrackPaths

briefdescription.para: Backtrack and find paths from the current airport to the destination in a graph.

detaileddescription.para: This function recursively backtracks and finds paths from the current airport to the destination in the given graph. It considers the distances provided and adds information about airlines between consecutive airports in the path. The results are stored in the allPaths vector.

briefdescription.para: Convert an airport name to its corresponding code.

detaileddescription.para: This function searches for airports in the given graph whose names match the input string. It displays the matching options and allows the user to select the desired option by entering a corresponding number. The function then returns the airport code for the selected option.

briefdescription.para: Convert a city name to corresponding airport codes.

detaileddescription.para: This function searches for airports in the given graph whose cities match the input string. It displays the matching options and allows the user to select the desired option by entering a corresponding number. The function then returns a vector of airport codes corresponding to the selected option.

briefdescription.para: Filter a graph based on user preferences.

detaileddescription.para: This function takes an original graph and applies user preferences to filter out vertices and edges. It removes airports, edges with avoided airlines, airports from avoided countries and cities, edges with non-preferred airlines, and airports not from preferred countries or cities.
